NATE SCHIER

Los Angeles, CA 90012
808-294-5948 | nathaniel.schier@gmail.com

SUMMARY

After co-founding and growing Sidebench for 5 years (#329 on the Inc. 500 list for 2017), I decided to leave the company in July 2017 to fulfill a long time desire to build my own software engineering skillset. Currently interested in contract work, apprenticeships, and potentially full-time positions with a high-performing team where I can both contribute and learn.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Full Stack JavaScript Engineer

Los Angeles, CA

Contract & Self-Study

September 2017 - Present

  • Focus primarily on full-stack JavaScript and more specifically React & Node
  • Learn through a mix of contract work, my own projects, tutorials, online reading, and contributing to open source
  • Enrolled in Harvardâ€™s CS50x to build foundational CS knowledge; estimated completion: March 2018
  • GitHub profile: https://github.com/cosst
  • Technologies: JavaScript, React, Vue, Node, Python, Express, MongoDB, RethinkDB, REST APIs, Mocha, Chai, webpack, Babel, Git, Yarn/npm, Heroku, Firebase

Sidebench

Los Angeles, CA

Co-Founder & Director

April 2012 - July 2017

  • Co-founded a leading LA-based product consulting company; bootstrapped it to $2.5m revenue in 2016
  • Ranked #329 on the 2017 Inc. 500 list with 3-year growth of 1346%
  • Responsible for everything early on; as company grew I focused primarily on internal operations, hiring & retention, and high-level account management along with some sales
  • Grew company from a group of remote contractors in 2012 to an in-house team of 20 employees in 2017; served as hiring manager across design, product, and engineering teams
  • Helped clients identify, design, develop, and launch strategic technology solutions; clients included Red Bull, Oakley, Andreessen Horowitz, NBC Universal, Inland Empire Health Plan, and Sony
  • Awards:
    • Top 5 Enterprise App & Web Developers in America (Clutch)
    • Top 5 Mobile App Developers in Los Angeles (SourcingLine)
    • Most Promising Enterprise Mobility Solution Providers (CIO Review Magazine)
    • 2017 Social Impact App - nOCD (Mobile UX Awards)
  • Left company voluntarily in July 2017 to build personal software engineering skillset

Elm Talent Group

New Haven, CT

Recruiting Associate & First Employee

August 2011 - September 2013

  • Connected intelligent early-career talent with elite retained clients in the finance, tech, and life science sectors
  • Responsible for client and candidate management, sourcing, screening, and closure; personally placed 25+ candidates at Bridgewater Associates, one of the most selective buy-side institutions in the New York area
  • As the first employee, helped name, brand, and build the company; implemented structure and training procedures in order to successfully onboard new Recruiting Associates

Hawaii Literacy

Honolulu, HI

ESL Center Director

June 2010 - May 2011

  • Managed and taught at English literacy non-profit; promoted from volunteer to lead teacher to director over the course of three months; provided free ESL instruction for ~250 students a year; grew center by 100% in one year

EDUCATION

Pomona College

Claremont, CA

B.A. English

May 2010

  • Extracurricular Activities: Rugby (2010 D2 National Champions), Varsity Football, ITS Helpdesk
  • Honors: Pomona College Scholar, National Football Foundation Hampshire Honor Society
  • Study Abroad: Beijing (Summer 2008), Edinburgh (Fall 2008)

SKILLS & INTERESTS

  • Skills: scrappiness, autodidacticism, listening, leadership, empathy, pattern recognition, mnemonic memory, dog whispering
  • Interests: my dog Daphne, NYT Crosswords, downtown LA, Mad Men, topographical maps, NY-style pizza, rugby, Hawaii
